content.description:
Start same as Oh-V1-Kenobi on obvious sidepull flake. After the first move, cross to a perfect finger bucket, and find your feet to make a couple more pulls through good holds to the top.

This can be weird to pad, so a couple pads, and a good spotter are highly recommended.

A variation starts same, but heads left (or more direct?) up through smaller holds to the top.
content.location: Starts on the same hold as Oh-V1-Kenobi

content.description: Sit start, right hand in bucket, left in good crimp about 16" over. Move straight up, take your pick of crimps en route to the great left facing jug. Move right to the u shaped flake for the traditional V3 finish. Or continue up - gaining an alternate V4 top on the quartzite band across the right facing ramp above.
content.protection: Lots of pads - you're right over a huge rock in the path, no flat ground. If you're dropping from the jug flake its not bad, but the V4 top is a bit tricky - be sure to pad the slope.
content.location: On masterlock boulder. When approaching masterlock boulder on trail, (r2-v2 boulder should be on your right, masterlock - not yet reached- on your left) continue along the first face passing along the large band of quartz rising up and right that starts at the arete. Route starts below, between huge left facing jug & end of quartz band, in front of the large rock in the path.

content.description:
Follow the crack to the left until the end of the overhang and top it out. The crux is generally just finding feet.

You can walk down to the right along the ledge.
content.location: Starts on the right side of masterlock boulder on a good hold at the bottom of the crack.

content.description: Sit start with right hand on a jug, left hand on slopey sidepull/undercling, and left heel hooked on the arete.  Slap up the overhanging face for a few moves until you can reach around left to the diagonal rail.  Work up the arete to one last hard move going to the crystal jug.
content.protection: A few pads and a spotter to keep you off the rocks.
content.location: On the arete at the left side of the main face of the Masterlock Boulder.

content.description:
Start at about chest height with left hand sidepulls (your choice) and a sloping pinch for the right hand. Figure out the feet then move up and slightly right towards the slab. Crux is figuring out how to hang onto a tiny crimp before moving to a good edge and a jug knob on the slab.

Down climb to the right, heading toward the tree right in the corner. You may want a pad to jump onto or do a V0/1 downclimb.
content.protection: A couple pads to cover the rock and roots which are center of the landing zone.
content.location: On the Masterlock boulder. On the right side of the tall orange face. Hard to miss since you walk past this to get to the Main Area with R2V2 and Oh-V1-Kenobi.

content.description: Start on left hand big crimp and right hand tiny crystal crimp. Make a big move out to a good right hand and surf edges to a juggy topout.

Sit start behind the large boulder on a rail with left hand gaston, and right hand on an edge. Get a tight heel hook, and make a powerful move straight up to a flat angled edge. Continue out through crimps and edges to the incut tooth-shaped flake and make one final move to the deep flake at the lip. A couple more easy moves land you on top of the boulder.

OG beta: Sit start on the dirt next to the rock with both hands on the flat rail. Move right hand to nub sidepull (same as the starting foot hold for Locksmith), walk feet into the incuts, and make a hard deadpoint with left hand to the flat hold. Finish up the same through the tooth.
content.protection: Pads. You may want a smaller pad to cover the rock while attempting the first move. Most remove the pad for the send to avoid the dab.
content.location: On the steep, main overhanging face of the Masterlock boulder. Start on the left side of the flat "pit" area right over the large boulder on the left side.

content.description: Start same as for Locksmith (left hand sidepull, right hand gaston on sloping rail). Do same first move, but head up and right through toothy incuts and big moves to the huge crystal jug and the topout for Oh-V1-Kenobi.
content.location: Starts on the middle main face of the masterlock boulder on a sloper ledge.

content.description: Start on a sloping shelf and a side pull out left. Make the super lockoff cross through to the right and then start traversing out left and up. When you hit the super incut crimp reach straight up for a good slot at the lip and top out.
content.location: In the center of the main face of the Masterlock boulder.

content.description: Start on the super low crimp footholds, do a wicked drop knee and link into Locksmith.
content.location: In the center of the main Masterlock face starting all the way at the bottom.

content.description: SDS with your left hand on the arete and right hand on the good hold about the same hight. Slap up and climb straight up the overhanging face to the top out.
content.location: On the far left side of the main face of the Masterlock Boulder. The start is between the arete and the large rock on the ground.

content.description: Start at the base of the obvious rail feature in the middle of the boulder. Start left hand on flat edge low, and right hand on bottom of the rail. Throw a high heel, the squeeze and crimp up the rail to a tiny crimp sidepull, and a big move to the huge jug.
content.location: Middle right of the main face of masterlock. Look for a slopy rail.
